question: What are the required key experts or engineer or personnels to meet the criteria? Does Gruner has key experts meeting these criterias?
answer:
Mentioned  
The tender specifies that the key experts required are:  

- Project manager (minimum 10 years’ infrastructure project‑management experience, EPC tender experience, FIDIC Yellow Book familiarity)  
- Electrical design manager (degree in Electrical/Power Engineering, ≥10 years with hydropower electrical systems and grid integration, EPC and FAT/SAT familiarity)  
- Mechanical design manager (degree in Mechanical Engineering, ≥10 years in hydropower or large‑scale infrastructure, expertise in hydro‑mechanical systems such as turbines, gates, valves, penstocks, etc.)  
- Civil design manager (degree in Civil or Hydraulic Engineering, ≥8 years in hydropower projects, knowledge of dams, intakes and waterway structures)  
- Quality manager (degree in Engineering, Quality Management or related, ≥10 years professional experience with ≥5 years in quality management on hydropower/energy projects, ISO 9001 experience)  
- ICT manager (degree in IT, Computer Science or related, 8–10 years ICT management in engineering or infrastructure projects, ability to establish and maintain project ICT systems)  

These roles and their experience thresholds are detailed in the tender conditions [Tender Conditions.pdf, p:8](chunkref://8); the evaluation will also consider the personnel’s qualifications, prior performance of corresponding roles, and documented experience in consulting on hydropower projects [Tender Conditions.pdf, p:19](chunkref://19).

The provided context does not contain any information about Gruner or its personnel, so it cannot be determined from the available documents whether Gruner has key experts that satisfy these requirements. [no evidence]

Description of quality assurance processes, resources and systems Alternative or subsidiary tenders No alternative or subsidiary tenders are accepted. A tenderer may only submit one tender. If a tenderer submits more than one tender, the
contracting entity will only take the latest submitted tender into consideration.

However, individual entities may participate as part of different consortia or groups of Tenderers,
provided that the entity itself does not submit more than one tender as a Tenderer.

If the tender contains more than one version of the same document, the contracting entity will
only take the latest uploaded version (according to the time-log in Dalux Tender) into
consideration.

4.5
Reservations

An organisational chart indicating the tenderer’s core organisation, the tenderer’s
overall project organisation, and links to the contracting entity 
The tenderer’s core organisation and key personnel 
How and how often the tenderer’s key personnel will be available to the contracting

The tenderer’s overall project organisation In the evaluation, the contracting entity will attach positive weight to: 
The core organisation being effective and functional, with the number of key personnel
adapted to the scope of services in the individual phases 
The use of consistent key personnel by the tenderer 
The key personnel of the tenderer being easily accessible to the contracting entity 
The overall project organisation of the tenderer being robust and including multiple
employees with relevant qualifications, including the ability to handle peak workloads
and access to staff with relevant specialist knowledge not possessed by the key
personnel 7.3.2
Subcriterion “Qualifications and experience of the personnel”
The evaluation will be carried out based on the CVs of the tenderer's project manager,
electrical/mechanical design managers, civil design manager, quality manager, ICT manager.
See section 4.4. When preparing CVs, the tenderer is encouraged to clearly and explicitly describe the key
person’s role on the executed projects and the specific tasks which the key person has performed
and/or has been responsible for. The tenderer is encouraged to limit the length of each completed CV to a maximum of five A4
pages. In the evaluation, the contracting entity will attach positive weight to: 
the key personnel having qualifications and experience within the roles they are to
perform in the tenderer’s project organisation.

the key personnel having previously performed corresponding roles.

the key personnel collectively have documented experience with the following: o
consulting on hydropower plants (preferably with bored penstocks in lakes,
then with tunnel works in rock, then other hydropower types)
o
client consultancy on major construction and civil engineering works
(preferably with a client responsible for the subsequent operation of an
electrical facility, then with a public client)
